name: You Are So Dead Quiz | Things in Common | 10 Questions

questions.text: What caused Detective Bobby Simone's death on "NYPD Blue"?
questions.explanation:
Bad Heart.

	Jimmy Smits death episode was one of the most watched episodes of "NYPD Blue". His sickness was covered in a multi-episode arc that ended in his death with his wife and partner by his bed side.

questions.text: Which doctor on "MASH" died when the plane he was in spun into the Sea of Japan?
questions.explanation:
Henry Blake.

	Henry's death was announced in the last few seconds of "Abyssina, Henry". Radar announced Colonel Blake's death while everyone was in the operating room. The death of Col. Henry Blake wasn't announced to cast members until the last second before the final scene was shot.

questions.text: Tessa Noel proved to us she wasn't immortal when she was shot and killed  while she waited on Duncan Macleod to take her home. On what show was Tessa killed?
questions.explanation:
Highlander.

	Tessa Noel was on twenty-six episodes of "Highlander" before she was killed off. She and Richie Ryan were shot, but Richie found that after being shot he was immortal. After Tessa's death, Duncan sold the antique shop and bought the gym where he and Richie worked out.

questions.text: This character's death on "The West Wing" shocked viewers because it was unexpected. The death was announced by Charlie to Leo outside the Oval Office. Whose unexpected death closed the episode of "18th and Potomac"?
questions.explanation:
Mrs. Landingham

	Every episode of "The West Wing" had a title that was mentioned by a character in that episode. Mrs. Landingham was killed in a car accident on 18th and Potomac while driving her newly purchased car back to the White House. Leo was coming in to talk to the president when Charlie told him Mrs. Landingham was killed in a car accident. The scene of Leo telling President Bartlet was shown through the double doors of the Oval Office, but the dialogue was never heard.

questions.text: Dr. George O'Malley had it tough at Seattle Grace, but his life and career tragically came to an end in 2009. How did Doctor O'Malley die?
questions.correct: Complications from being dragged by a bus
questions.explanation:
Complications from being dragged by a bus.

	George O'Malley became an intern at Seattle Grace Hospital in 2005. In the  2009 season finale, George pushed a woman out of the way of an oncoming bus and was hit and dragged several feet. No one at Seattle Grace knew the bus accident victim was George until he signed '007' on Meredith's palm. In 2005, George was given the nickname by Alex upon almost killing a patient during an appendectomy surgery.

questions.text: Robert McAllister was taken off life support a year after a horrible car accident on what nighttime TV series?
questions.explanation:
Brothers and Sisters.

	Viewers of the May 14, 2010 season finale thought Robert would succumb to a heart attack, but on the last few moments of the ABC series "Brother and Sisters", Robert McAllister was involved in a multiple car accident. When the show returned on September 26, 2010, Robert was in a vegetative state and Kitty ended life support.

questions.text: After appearing for two seasons on "Friends", this downstairs neighbor of Monica and Rachel's died with a broomstick in his hand. What was the name of the neighbor?
questions.explanation:
Mr. Heckles

	Mr. Heckles had always used a broomstick on the ceiling of his apartment to quiet the gang. When he suddenly stopped, the gang found him dead in his apartment. After looking through his apartment, Chandler Bing realized he could one day end up being a Mr. Heckles.

questions.text: Alice Garvey died in a fire at the blind school while trying to get Adam Jr. and herself out of the house. What show had this horrific fire?
questions.explanation:
Little House on the Prairie.

	Alice Garvey and Adam Kendall, Jr. died in the year 1870 when Albert Ingalls and his friend, Clay, caused an accidental fire in the basement of the blind school.

questions.text: Robin and Stone were a "General Hospital" super couple and remained such until Stone's death in 1995. How did Stone die?
options: Stepped in front of a bullet for Sonny
He died in a car accident
questions.explanation:
Complications from AIDS.

	Michael "Stone" Cates came onto "General Hospital" in 1993. Viewers went wild over Robin and Stone's love story, especially after Stone was diagnosed as having AIDS. Stone died in Sonny's penthouse with Robin by his side in 1995. Sonny donated money for an AIDS wing at the hospital and gave his son Morgan the middle name of Stone, after his good friend.

questions.text: You could call Dr. Robert Romano's death poetic justice. Outside of Cook County General, he was killed when an out of control helicopter fell on top of him. On what medical show did this death occur?
questions.explanation:
ER.

	Paul McCrane came onto "ER" full time in season four of the medical drama "ER". He died six years later on Thanksgiving Day when an out of control helicopter fell on top of him in front of Cook County General.
